subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue
msgSnippet: ... assertTrue(someCondition == false); makes more sense to me.  And I m pretty sure that the compiled code is the same (but I haven t checked) ... You will
messageBody:
> Does anyone else find it odd to write something like:
>
> assertTrue(!someCondition);

assertTrue(someCondition == false);

makes more sense to me. And I'm pretty sure that the compiled code is the same (but I haven't checked)

> Would it make sense to add a corresponding assertFalse(someCondition) to
> JUnit?

You will soon have demands for assertNotEquals, assertNotSame, assertGreaterThan, assertNotGreaterThan, assertLessThan, assertLesserThan, assertALittleBitLesserThan...

-Vladimir
